snippet: An armed security guard at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, held out as an example of a failing Secret Service, wonders why he was fired after operating an elevator for President Obama.
abstract: Kenneth Tate, former security guard at Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, questions why he was fired by the agency after operating elevator for Pres Obama; Tate was carrying CDC-issued firearm at the time, and his case was used as example of failing Secret Service.
lead_paragraph: An armed security guard at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, held out as an example of a failing Secret Service, wonders why he was fired after operating an elevator for President Obama.

headline.main: One Day in an Elevator With Obama, Then Out of a Job
headline.print_headline: One Day in an Elevator With the President, the Next Week Out of a Job

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
